subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In all regions except Japan, the middle component is written {{l|mul|犬}}, which is the orthodox form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}. * In Japanese {{w|shinjitai}}, the middle component is written {{l|mul|大}} instead of {{l|mul|犬}} (the upper right dot is missing). Due to {{w|Han unification}}, both forms are encoded using the same [[code point]]. This character may appear to be different depending on the font used. * A {{w|CJK Compatibility Ideographs|CJK compatibility ideograph}} exists at U+FA38 for the {{w|kyūjitai}} form of {{lang|ja|器}} which has {{l|mul|犬}} as the middle component. * Another character, {{l|mul|𠾖}} (U+20F96) exists for the historical form found in the {{w|Ming dynasty}} {{lang|zh|《直音篇》}} Chinese dictionary which is similar to Japanese {{w|shinjitai}}.
